cleaned_text: What Are Vaccines? Created in laboratories by specialized scientists, vaccines help prevent serious diseases, including COVID-19, polio, measles, mumps, shingles, chickenpox and many more. Vaccines have greatly reduced or eliminated life-threatening diseases that used to kill or disable millions of children and adults. Depending on the vaccine, you may receive it: - By injection (shot) - Through a nasal spray - Orally (drops)
